fact: Did you know? The Great Pyramid of Giza was built over 4,500 years ago and was the tallest man-made structure for centuries.
Did you know? Julius Caesar was assassinated on the Ides of March, 44 BC, by members of the Roman Senate.
Did you know? The Black Death killed an estimated 25–50% of Europe’s population in the 14th century.
Did you know? Leonardo da Vinci was not only a painter but also an inventor, scientist, and engineer.
Did you know? The printing press, invented by Johannes Gutenberg in the 15th century, revolutionized the spread of knowledge.
Did you know? The American Revolution began in 1775 and led to the creation of the United States of America.
Did you know? The Great Fire of London in 1666 destroyed over 13,000 houses but only six people were recorded dead.
Did you know? Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself emperor of France in 1804, rather than letting the Pope do it.
Did you know? The Silk Road was an ancient trade route connecting China with Europe and facilitating cultural exchange.
Did you know? The Vikings used longships to travel vast distances and even reached North America around 1000 AD.
Did you know? The Battle of Hastings in 1066 led to Norman control of England.
Did you know? The Colosseum in Rome could hold up to 50,000 spectators for gladiatorial games.
Did you know? During the Renaissance, Florence became a major center of art, culture, and humanism.
Did you know? The Library of Alexandria was one of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world.
Did you know? The Mongol Empire, founded by Genghis Khan, became the largest contiguous empire in history.
Did you know? The first successful flight by the Wright brothers occurred in 1903 in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.
Did you know? The Treaty of Versailles, signed in 1919, formally ended World War I.
Did you know? The French Revolution began in 1789 and led to the rise of Napoleon Bonaparte.
Did you know? The Great Wall of China is over 13,000 miles long and took centuries to build.
Did you know? Samurai warriors in Japan followed a strict code of honor called Bushido.
Did you know? The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 18th century and transformed the world economy.
Did you know? The Spanish Armada of 1588 was a failed attempt by Spain to invade England.
Did you know? Ancient Egyptians believed cats were sacred and protected their homes from evil spirits.
Did you know? The Rosetta Stone helped scholars decipher Egyptian hieroglyphs.
Did you know? The Boston Tea Party in 1773 was a protest against British taxation in America.
Did you know? In medieval Europe, people believed bathing too often was dangerous for health.
Did you know? The Ottoman Empire lasted over 600 years before dissolving after World War I.

Did you know? The Wright Flyer was the first powered airplane, flown by Orville and Wilbur Wright.

Did you know? The Taj Mahal was built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
Did you know? The Battle of Thermopylae in 480 BC featured 300 Spartans fighting the Persian army.

Did you know? Cleopatra VII was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt.
Did you know? During the Victorian era, arsenic was used in wallpapers, cosmetics, and even toys.
Did you know? The discovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming in 1928 revolutionized medicine.
Did you know? The Colossus of Rhodes was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Did you know? The Crusades were a series of religious wars in medieval Europe during the 11th–13th centuries.

Did you know? Napoleon Bonaparte was exiled to the island of Elba before escaping to power again.
Did you know? The Rosetta Stone contained the same text in Greek, Demotic, and Hieroglyphics.
Did you know? In medieval times, books were so rare that chains were used to secure them in libraries.
Did you know? The Great Fire of Rome in 64 AD destroyed much of the city during Emperor Nero’s reign.
Did you know? The Boston Massacre in 1770 fueled revolutionary sentiment in the American colonies.
Did you know? The Aztec Empire had a complex calendar system and built the city of Tenochtitlan on a lake.
Did you know? In the Middle Ages, 'trial by ordeal' was a common way to determine guilt or innocence.
Did you know? The Gutenberg Bible was the first major book printed using movable type in Europe.
Did you know? The Siege of Constantinople in 1453 marked the end of the Byzantine Empire.
Did you know? The Code of Hammurabi is one of the oldest deciphered writings of significant length in the world.
Did you know? The Magna Carta, signed in 1215, limited the powers of the English king.

Did you know? The Louisiana Purchase was completed for $15 million in 1803.
Did you know? The Viking longships could navigate both open seas and shallow rivers.
Did you know? During the Renaissance, artists often experimented with new pigments and materials to create vibrant paintings.
